intro: Randia megacarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited randia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds. Randia megacarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
